did.unittitle: Cleveland Electric Company Rules & Regulations for the Conductors and Motormen Booklet,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Cleveland Electric Company's Rules and Regulations for the Conductors and Motormen booklet.

bioghist.p: The Cleveland Electric Railway Company was created by a merger of the East Cleveland, Broadway & Newburgh, Brooklyn, and South Side railway companies on May 15, 1893. The Cleveland Electic Railway Company was one of two local transit companies; the other was the Cleveland City Cable Company. These two companies controlled the streetcar industry in Cleveland, Ohio, and merged into one company in 1903. (Information retrieved from The Encyclopedia of Cleveland History (http://ech.case.edu/cgi/article.pl?id=CERC) on December 23, 2016.)

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one booklet, "Rules and Regulations for the Conductors and Motormen of the Cleveland Electric Railway Company."

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

scopecontent.p: Table of contents: 1. General Rules, p. 3; 2. Conductor, p. 11; 3. Motorman, p. 21; 4. Ordinance 3359, p. 31.
